channel.title: Software Development Life Cycle on Getting Started Guides

item.title: Data Flow Diagrams
item.description: Data Flow Diagrams (DFD) # What are Data Flow Diagrams (DFD)? # This is a diagram that maps out the flow of information for any system. There are defined symbols like rectangles, circles, arrows, and so on to distinguish different parts of the system. There are different kinds of data flow diagrams as well, most are separated into either logical DFD or Physical DFD. Logical data flow diagrams focuses on the system process(es).

item.title: Build Tools
item.description: What is a build tool? # A build tool is a programming utility that automates a software build task, such as compiling source code, cleaning temporary files, and so on. A popular open source build tool is Make, another popular build tool is Maven GNU Make # Make is a build tool released by GNU. Make was original designed to work with C source code. Make configurations are specified by a text file named Makefile.
